researcher.name: Harikrishnan S
researcher.quote: The best part about working with frogs is watching them in the wild. I mean, have you seen how cute they are?

content.intro: High in India's misty Western Ghats mountains lives a tiny frog that glows like a living jewel. And this little one doesn't wait around to grow up!

facts.title: No Tadpole? No Problem!
facts.text: These frogs skip the tadpole stage completely. The eggs hatch straight into tiny, fully-formed frogs!

facts.title: Walkers, Not Hoppers
facts.text: Unlike most frogs, these little ones don't like to hop. Instead, they walk clumsily along grass blades!

facts.title: Hide and Seek Champions
facts.text: They hide from flashlights! When researchers shine lights at night, these frogs sneak away into the grass.

content.fieldNote: Resplendent Grass Frogs have evolved to survive in the cold, open grasslands in the mountains of Western Ghats. More than 70% of these grasslands have disappeared, and now the surviving frogs are threatened by habitat loss and climate change.

images.caption: A Resplendent Grass Frog showing off its brilliant orange and black pattern
Look at those glowing eyes! The name 'resplendens' means 'shining' in Latin
